plants.name: Rosa Ã— centifolia
plants.description: A popular cultivated garden rose known for its dense, rodent-like petals and strong, sweet fragrance. It produces large, lush pink blooms often used in perfumery.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June)
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially Europe and North America
plants.funFact: The Damascus rose (a type of Rosa centifolia) has been cultivated for over 2,000 years!

plants.name: Erythrina Crista-galli
plants.description: A deciduous tree producing striking bright red, elongated flowers shaped like a rooster's spur, attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to early summer (September to December in Southern Hemisphere; May in some regions)
plants.location: Native to South America, notably Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil
plants.funFact: It is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial wildflower with tall racemes of densely packed pea-like flowers, often in shades of purple, blue, pink, and white, favored by bees.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to July)
plants.location: Native to western North America, commonly found in meadows and open forests
plants.funFact: Lupines improve soil fertility by fixing nitrogen through symbiosis with bacteria in their root nodules.

plants.name: Cornus florida
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its large white or pink bracts that look like petals surrounding small greenish-yellow flowers.
plants.location: Eastern United States and parts of Mexico
plants.funFact: The wood of the flowering dogwood is very hard and was historically used for making tool handles and golf club heads.
